summary: SummaryHighlightsClean IngredientsCruelty FreeVeganSustainable PackagingGive BackBLUME's Daydreamer Face Wash is oh-so-calming and packed with the best plant extracts. It's designed to effectively clean without stripping the skin of its natural healthy oils. Perfect for sensitive skin and leaves it feeling even, plump, and supple after every wash - never tight or dry.
details: DetailsKey IngredientsChamomile: The pro for chilling out any rednessLavender: Redness, acne, and bacteria are no match for this power plantRapeseed Oil: An antioxidant rich with Omega-3 and Omega-6Formulated WithoutAlcoholSulfatesParabensSiliconesItem 2579267How To UseMassage 2-3 pumps of Daydreamer onto a wet face, then rinse well and gently pat dry with your clean towel.BLUME PRODUCTS ARE BETTER TOGETHER: for clear, healthy, glowing skin, add Meltdown Acne Oil and Whirl Moisturizer to your routine.Precautions: External use only.IngredientsAqua, Brassica Campestris (Rapeseed) Seed Oil, Stearic Acid, Stearyl Alcohol, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Hydroxypropyl Starch Phosphate, Glyceryl Stearate, Glycerine, Propanediol, Sodium Cocoyl Isethionate, Decyl Glucoside, Arginine, Caprylyl Glycol, Natamycin, Pelargonium Graveolens (Geranium) Flower Oil, Lavandula Angustifolia (Lavender) Oil, Ormenis Multicaulis (Chamomile) Flower Extract, Arnica Montana Flower Extract, Citric Acid.
how_to_use: Massage 2-3 pumps of Daydreamer onto a wet face, then rinse well and gently pat dry with your clean towel.BLUME PRODUCTS ARE BETTER TOGETHER: for clear, healthy, glowing skin, add Meltdown Acne Oil and Whirl Moisturizer to your routine.Precautions: External use only.

reviews.headline: Wanted to support a South Asian owned business but...
reviews.comments: This cleanser, if you can even call it that, was disappointing. There's no lather. It feels like you're washing your face with lotion. It irritates my skin. And it doesn't remove makeup unless you use it more than once at a time.

reviews.headline: Lovely cleanser
reviews.comments: Very nourishing and fresh scented! Perfect second cleanser. Only wish they sold in a larger size and the pump tends to dispense an excess of product.

reviews.headline: doesn't do anything
reviews.comments: i rarely write reviews but this legit did nothing for my skin... it doesn't even lather in your hands. you could just not wash your face and get the exact same results. i gave it a solid 2 weeks to work and ended up breaking out more than usual, not like a reaction but i knew it wasn't doing anything. not sure if i got a bad batch or something but it absolutely did not work. wish i could get my money back.

reviews.headline: Very gentle cream cleanser
reviews.comments: Very happy with this purchase. Was drawn to it by using the meltdown oil (which is also amazing) and reading the reviews. Very happy with how gentle it is and my face feels soft and not dried out.

reviews.headline: amazing!
reviews.comments: I wanted to start using a retinol product in my routine, so I had to change ALL my skincare to be able to do so with no reactions (chemical exfoliates, etc.) Decided to try Blume since it's clean ingredients, and I love it! My fave feels so soft after this cleanser. I use the acne oil and meltdown moisturizer too, and I've noticed a reduction in acne and redness. If I do get a pimple, it's gone quickly. Try this brand out!!! I've tried MANY, and I think I'll be sticking around this brand < 3

reviews.headline: Perfect gentle second wash
reviews.comments: I use this as my second cleanse step aftet elf makeup removing balm. I have sensitive skin that tends to be dry and as I approach middle age I am very wary of foaming face washes- hence I use none! I dont even use shampoo except once a week. This stuff is like magic. I dont understand the low rating or poor reviews. It cleanses my skin so gently but thoroughly. 10/10 would recommend.

reviews.headline: At least it was gentle
reviews.comments: I've worked in skincare for 15 years and this is probably in the top 5 worst face cleansers for me. I ended up saving it for the shower for morning cleanses.

reviews.headline: Obsessed
reviews.comments: So thankful I found this brand and this cleanser! The only thing that has helped clear my acne and make me feel confident in my skin.

reviews.headline: My ALL TIME favorite cleanser!!
reviews.comments: Having combo skin (more on the oily side) I had always opted for cleansers that stripped away all my natural oils to feel "clean" but little did I know back then that's the worst thing you can do for oily skin. Since I found Blume products, my skin has never looked better. I love how natural the ingredients are and no harsh chemicals are used. My face feels clean and supple, not stripped and dry like most cleansers. It creates a healthy balance and I have WAYYYY less breakouts than before. I used to have uncontrollable cystic acne around my chin that drastically improved after using this brand and now I rarely ever have them. If I do I use the Melt Down and it really helps. Battling oily skin by stripping away the oil is such a no go. I'm so happy I found this product and learned how to actually care for my skin. Please don't ever stop making this!! I'm already torn up that Stargirl is no longer available!

reviews.headline: Won't buy again
reviews.comments: I bought this initially back in December 2022 because it had all 5 star reviews. It's probably one of the most useless face washes I've used (not to be dramatic ðŸ˜‚). It feels like just slides all over my face, is slimy, and never actually sets in...so my face never actually felt clean. I think I used it 4-5 times before I just gave up.

reviews.headline: Amazing
reviews.comments: Love this product so much!

reviews.headline: Disappointed - love the brand mission
reviews.comments: I wanted to love this product, but it clearly did not really wash off my makeup because I broke out sooo bad using this face wash. I switched recently and within 3 days my skin is so much clearer. I have the whole line of products so hopefully the others begin to work better with a new face wash.

reviews.headline: Great product, horrible packaging
reviews.comments: I really like this cleanser but hate the packaging. The small bottle lasts me less than a month and I only use 2 pumps per day (I use this at night and a different cleanser in the morning). Once the bottle is over half gone, it becomes impossible to pump out any more product so you end up taking out the pump and pounding the bottle into your palm for the next week until it's gone. I've been using this cleanser for a few years and really hoped they would have fixed this problem by now as many other reviewers have complained about the same thing.

reviews.headline: Not a face wash
reviews.comments: This is a nice cleanser but it is not a face wash as described. Super bummed to receive the item and discover this.

reviews.headline: Didn't get makeup off
reviews.comments: I double cleanse and used this after my oil cleanser. It didn't seem to do much. Felt like over priced cold cream.

reviews.headline: Overpowering scent
reviews.comments: The scent on this product is so overpowering. It also caused me to break out

reviews.headline: I really wanted to like it!
reviews.comments: After searching for a good cleanser, this one failed me as well. I read a good bit of the reviews and really wanted to like it. However, I have really sensitive skin and it made my skin feel like it was burning and I got red bumps all over. I must be reacting to one of the ingredients.

reviews.headline: I'm 50 and I've tried them all
reviews.comments: This is hands down the best face wash I've ever used in my life! I've tried everything . Literally. I cannot wait to stock up again and hope they come out with more products-- love their stuff!

reviews.headline: Amazing Gentle Cleanser!
reviews.comments: I love this cleanser! It smells so nice, very much like the Lush Vanishing Cream Moisturizer (if you've ever smelled that). It is a non-sudsy consistency, so it doesn't necessarily give me that "squeaky-clean" feeling, but it feels nice & gentle. I have skin that is sensitive to some medicated cleansers that have salicylic acid in them, so my skin tends to dry out and get irritated with some everyday cleansers. But not this one! This leaves my skin feeling nice & not stripped of its natural oils. The formula is really gentle. My skin has not been dry since using this. Will continue to use!

reviews.headline: This is a cream cleanser
reviews.comments:
at my 20s, I love stripping cleanser cos I have combo skin. But now i am in my mid 30s, I love cream cleansers. If you are also looking for a cream cleanser, this is a nice one! it cleans nicely without stripping and I love the subtle lavender scent. 
My only complaint is I wish they have a bigger bottle.
ps: for cream cleansers, you need to use more products than a foaming cleanser(usually I use 2-3 pumps). and you need to double cleanse in the PM (that's like 6-9 pumps per day), thus a 4oz cream cleanser doesn't really last very long. given the price and how much product it has, I think the Philosophy Purity Cleanser(also a cream cleanser) has a much better value (32oz for MSRP$59 and they have BOGO a few times a year)

media.headline: Not sure if it's my forever cleanser..
Amazing face wash and my skin has never been softer!
Amazing face wash and my skin has never been softer!
Hormonal acne is terrified of this cleanser!

faceoff_positive.comments: Thus far, I'm loving my purchase!   I've been using everything for about two weeks now so not a long enough time for me to truly review how they benefit my skin long term, but short term, they've been fantastic. I've got extremely oily skin and am prone to breakouts (especially when I'm under a lot of stress) and so far, I'm not noticing any additional breakouts, which is great (it's been a huge concern of mine in the past when even thinking of switching products; I've been very happy with the products - that took forever for me to find - that kept my breakouts at bay and have always been very hesitant to stop using them, but I have since using Blume. Whirl gives my skin a very dewy look - I'm trying to get used to it because while it looks healthy, I equate that with oil for my skin. My skin has been soft and glowing. And I LOVE how the products smell.  We'll see if I still rate this 5 stars after a few months of use, especially in the summer with humidity and heat (I'm definitely concerned how the dewy look I'm rocking through the winter will end up looking horrid in the summer).
faceoff_positive.headline: Thus far, I'm loving my

faceoff_negative.comments: I was super excited to try Blume's line of products after a friend told me about meltdown. Meltdown does absolutely nothing for me, but that's for a different review. Daydreamer was a dream come true in Toronto's cold dry winter weather, I used it religiously for 4 months & my skin was so happy with Daydreamer, Stargirl mist & my moisturizer. However. I've been in Jamaica & Trinidad & Tobago for 2 months now, and my skin hasn't broken out this badly ever. My skin was so healthy & clear using Daydreamer in a cold climate, so once I arrived in the Caribbean I changed nothing. Worst idea ever. I now understand what some of the other reviewers are saying about this feeling like sunscreen or some weird thick lotion. In the heat it leaves a super sticky, gross film of residue on my face. I realized after less than a week of use that I needed to switch up my skincare routine, as continuing to use Daydreamer was creating cystic acne unlike anything I've ever experienced, also in areas I never get pimples. I was breaking out on my chin & cheeks & forehead - even my temples & around my lips had cystic pimples! SO bad. I've spent plenty of time in tropical climates my whole life & never had a problem with breakouts in the heat. First I cut out stargirl thinking maybe that was the problem. Nope. My skin continued to get worse. I've stopped using Daydreamer for about 6 weeks & my skin is clearing up...... now I'll just have to figure out how to fade the new acne scars all over my face. I'm scared to try daydreamer again in any climate after what it did to my face. Canceling my Auto-renew subscription. So sad cause I thought I'd found the perfect cleanser for my dry skin. Pic is of the remaining scars & bumps caused by this cleanser, one month later. I didn't take any pics of my face at its worst.
faceoff_negative.headline: Mixed results :(
